Method Detail

setLicenseKey

public static void setLicenseKey(String key)
Sets the license key of this plugin. Used when generating unique ID. The license key can also been set at startup time using the system property fr.apteryx.imageio.dicom.key.

setSubSerial

public static void setSubSerial(int ss)
Only available to owners of an unlimited license: this number will be appened to the license unique serial number when generating unique UID.

setApplicationTitle

public static void setApplicationTitle(String n)
Sets the default local application title when connecting to a remote application entity. The size of the name must not exceed 16 characters.

Default value is "ImageIO Plugin"

getApplicationTitle

public static String getApplicationTitle()
Gets the default local application title used when connecting to a remote application entity.

setARTIM

public static void setARTIM(int a)
Set the ARTIM timeout used when waiting for an association request after accepting a TCP connection, and for a TCP remote close when association no longer exists.

Default value is 30000

Parameters:
a - the timeout value, in milliseconds

serversAreDaemons

public static boolean serversAreDaemons()
Returns true is server threads are daemon threads.

setServersAreDaemons

public static void setServersAreDaemons(boolean b)
Determines if server threads created in the future by the plugin are daemon threads. The default is true.

getDefaultPort

Returns the default port when starting a server with insecure transport. Default value is 104

addSupportedSOPClass

public static void addSupportedSOPClass(String uid)
Adds a SOP class or Meta-SOP class to the list of classes claimed to be supported by the plugin at association establishment time.

Call this method to allow exchange of instances belonging to non-standard SOP classes.

Parameters:
uid - The unique UID of the (meta-)SOP class.
See Also:
removeSupportedSOPClass(String)

removeSupportedSOPClass

public static void removeSupportedSOPClass(String uid)
Removes a SOP class or Meta-SOP class from the list of classes claimed to be supported by the plugin at association establishment time.

Parameters:
uid - The unique UID of the (meta-)SOP class.
See Also:
addSupportedSOPClass(String)

setSpecificCharacterSet

public static void setSpecificCharacterSet(String cs)
                                    throws UnsupportedEncodingException
Automatically encodes textual information with the specified character set. Both DICOM and Java names are accepted. By default, the ISO_IR 100 (ISO-8859-1) is used.

If set to not-null, the Specific Character Set (0008,0005) attribute will be automatically added to all objects written by DicomWriter and all Idenfiers sent by the Query/Retrieve and Basic Worklist Management SCU and SCP. Following the standard, the attributes of VR SH, LO, ST, PN, LT and UT in a data set containing a Specific Character Set have their value encoded using this character set. If the object or identifier already contains the Specific Character Set attribute, its value won't be overriden.

If null is passed to this method, no such Specific Character Set attribute will be added. However, the strings will still be encoded using ISO_IR 100 (ISO-8859-1), so care must be taken to not write characters not in the basic character repertoire (US-ASCII) to be coherent with the absence of Specific Character Set attribute.

Supported character sets are:

DICOM defined termJava name
ISO_IR 100ISO-8859-1
ISO_IR 101ISO-8859-2
ISO_IR 109ISO-8859-3
ISO_IR 110ISO-8859-4
ISO_IR 144ISO-8859-5
ISO_IR 127ISO-8859-6
ISO_IR 126ISO-8859-7
ISO_IR 138ISO-8859-8
ISO_IR 148ISO-8859-9
ISO_IR 13JIS_X0201
ISO_IR 166ISO-8859-11
GB18030GB18030
ISO_IR 192UTF-8
If the JVM does not support the character set specified, an UnsupportedEncodingException exception is thrown.

Character sets with code extensions are not supported.

Throws:
UnsupportedEncodingException
